intro: Ceodes brunoniana, commonly known as the New Zealand broom. It is a flowering plant native to New Zealand, belonging to the Fabaceae family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It has compound leaves with three to five leaflets and is often found in coastal and inland scrublands. Ceodes brunoniana is adapted to a variety of soil types and is relatively drought-tolerant.
